alert.note: Alert for Buchanan; Dickenson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 3:29PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A line of thunderstorms will impact portions of Dickenson, Buchanan, northwestern McDowell, southeastern Mingo, southeastern Logan and western Wyoming Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 324 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of thunderstorms over Garden Village, or near Pikeville, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clintwood, Grundy, Pineville, Haysi, Breaks Interstate, John Flannagan Lake, Mullens, Oceana, Man, Hanover, R.d. Bailey Lake, Gilbert Creek, Mallory, Amherstdale-Robinette, Big Rock, Paw Paw, Hinch, Gilbert, Davy and Clinchco. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this line of thunderstorms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Flash Flood Watch remains in effect. Heavy downpours could cause rapid rises in water. If rising water is observed, move to higher ground. Do not drive into areas covered by water.
